alert.note: Alert for Dickens; Kent; King; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 5:58PM CDT until June 02 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN KENT...DICKENS...WESTERN KING AND MOTLEY COUNTIES... At 557 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Mcadoo to 4 miles west of Girard, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Spur, Matador, Dickens, Girard, Dumont, Afton, Mcadoo and Roaring Springs. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Texas. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
